Reviews.Title: Great Kitchen HD TV!
Reviews.Author: Rhea C. Beto "North Dakota"
Reviews.Content: We just bought a new house and needed a new HD TV for the kitchen, so we bought this one.  It has worked AWESOME!  The picture is great from all angles.  The volume is just fine - dishwasher running and everything.  The screen is plenty big, too, and we have a pretty big kitchen.  Now we can eat breakfast, do make-up, and pack our lunch while we watch a little news in the morning.  I'm very happy with this product!

Reviews.Title: Certainly not the best TV, but still a good value
Reviews.Author: Eric S. Olstad
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't rave about this TV at all.  There's nothing spectacular about it in any way.  It's completely average, but that's what I bought it for.  We picked up this TV to use with our treadmill so we were really just looking for something with a decent price.  This one was the lowest price and met the specifications we wanted.Having said that, I am completely satisfied.  It has a digital tuner so it picked up all the "over-the-air" channels just fine.  However, the process was ridiculously long.  It took probably around an hour to auto-program the TV channels.  I didn't clock it.  I just walked away and then the TV popped on so much later that I had completely forgot it was working.The picture is fine.  It's not the best, but it's good enough.  The sound is a bit lacking though.  At its loudest, you can't even hear it over the treadmill so we have to hook up headphones to it, which is fine.  Sound quality is average.Other than that, this TV DOES have an HDMI output.  I know one reviewer was complaining that it didn't, but maybe he got an older model.  The one I got definitely has an HDMI port though I believe the model number might be HDLCD1912a.  I suppose they don't make the plain 1912 anymore, I don't know.  For this TV, though, with it's average quality, an HDMI cable is really just a convenience of having one cable and not something you need to get maximum sound and video quality.So, if you're looking for something simple to throw in your kitchen or in your workout room or something like that, then this is the way to go.  But if you're looking for something for your Xbox or Playstation or as your main TV, then I would suggest spending a little bit more money and getting a better device.  This one is sure NOT to wow anyone, but it will get the job done.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV but no HDMI!!
Reviews.Author: FirePower "FirePower"
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with this tv but I was very disappointed when I found out that I'd been duped. No HDMI inputs on this tv, anywhere! Not even a DVI input. Someone else suggested that I probably got an earlier model of this tv and that could be true. Anyway, here goes any hope I had of upcoverting my SD DVDs on my DVD player. Anyway, over the air HD stations come in crystal clear and so do my HD cable channels. All in all, a decent tv for such a low price.

Reviews.Title: Great little LCD TV over all, but something not so great.....
Reviews.Author: Natja K.
Reviews.Content: FIRST THE POSITIVES:I got this little TV at walmart for $98 last night, black friday. Now honestly for $98 bucks it really is a steal. It works flawlessly. The default color is nearly perfect without any user calibration. Perhaps a bit too saturated but that is easily udjusted. There are plenty of settings on this tv for picture and sound. There are numerous picture modes as well as several color temperature adjustments. Of course there are the usual contrast, tint, sharpness, brightness etc., But I was also suprised to find a level for the backlight, which can be helpful in improving black levels.As with all LCD flat panel tv's, it is a flawed technology. This due to the viewing axis issues that exist when the TV is watched from the far left, far right, and too high above or below, there is a limited playing field to see the best possible image. And it's about what you'd expect for low priced LCD TV's. Not bad but I have seen better. The backlight control when turned down can help eliminate some of that dull gray washout the you see in the darkest content, but it doesn't get rid of it all. Instead of total black you get a glowing gray when things get rather dark in source material. But this is a common problem with flat panel LCD. Again, it's not all that bad, and the sharpness and image quality is really excellent. So much so that even though it's 720p native dvd's look excellent but blu-rays look every bit as good on this TV as our much more expensive 47' LCD tv.A nice addition is that there is an adjustable 8 band graphic EQ, or you can choose from 7 presets, or just go with flat and then increase the available bass and treble levels.NOW THE NOT SO GOOD NEWS:There is an issue I can't ignore. For one thing the only inputs are RCA video, RCA L/R sound, and HDMI. However there is a digital coaxial output for 5.1 surround into a reciever. The bad news is that this output can only be used with what ever TV channel your running into the TV. It can't send this multi-channel audio coming in from HDMI from what ever source you send into the TV, such as a blu-ray player. This I found rather lame to be honest. Now my blu-ay player does not have any coaxial or optical output, and my reciever has no HDMI input, only optical and coaxial. So unless you have a reciever with HDMI then your going to have to live with L/R stereo into your receiver or just use the TV speakers.For such a small TV the sound is better than I would have expected. It sounds pretty good, and there is a simulated surround effect you can activate to spacialize the sound, but it is a far cry from what a good reciever can do. So this is the reason for the 3 star rating.None the less for $98 why complain? Other than that the TV has simply gorgeous image, and the fact that even though it is native 720p, because the pixels are so tiny, with Blu-ray and HD signals it looks every bit as good as 1080p. I have experienced no issues at all with operation. The TV works great... so far.

Reviews.Title: What A Deal!
Reviews.Author: Bruce L
Reviews.Content: This was to replace an old CRT in the bedroom. Perfect dimensions for the space I had to work with. Good port availability (OK, would have appreciated two HDMI ports, but hey...) and ease of setup for a fantastic picture. More surprising was the robust sound produced by the forward-facing, stereo speakers. I have had the displeasure of hearing some other units tinny and downright pathetic sound quality (out of some pretty big name brands). I had already planned on having to hook up some external solution, but after hearing it, ended up not running anything extra. Really pleased to date with operation, not one problem to report. For the price and size this was one really great deal!

Reviews.Title: Great little television~!
Reviews.Author: Concerned Soapmaker
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my new kitchen. I couldn't wait until the kitchen was done, so set it up to see how it worked. The picture is clear, the sound is very good, especially for a small room. I was influenced after buying the same brand in a 32" for my bedroom.I would recommend this TV wholeheartedly. I can't wait now until it is hung on the wall in the newly remodeled kitchen!

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Nona B. Sneiss
Reviews.Content: Excellent if you are a college student and you live in a dorm by yourself. It's meant to be watched by 1 person. So, it's perfect for me! I've had it for 3 months now. No problems yet (fingers crossed)!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Kendra
Reviews.Content: THE PICTURE IS AMAZING. I BOUGHT TWO. ONE FOR MY BEDROOM AND ONE FOR MY TEENAGE SON'S BEDROOM.

Reviews.Title: Good but no QAM
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: This TV is just okay, for bedroom or other low use areas.  It doesn't seem to have a QAM tuner to allow you to access sub-channels like 3.2, 15.2, etc. while on cable(I have others that do this, including a Digital Labs 7"!)  You have to totally reprogram this TV to broadcast to get the HD channels.  The picture seems pretty good for cable though, so keeping it for limited use.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for kitchen
Reviews.Author: John P. Reed "jreed0122"
Reviews.Content: As someone else stated, this is a great TV for the kitchen.  Support Cable QAM perfectly.  Great Picture...really not much else to add.  Check my pictures out for details on the connections.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised!
Reviews.Author: P. Fleury
Reviews.Content: I ordered the set based upon two five star reviews, and they were spot on.  I don't have it connected for HDTV in the kitchen, but the analog picture is very clear and sharp.  There is an interesting optional picture mode which spreads the standard 4:3 TV image across the 16:9 ratio screen so that the center of the image looks pretty normal and the edges are stretched more.  This works well for individuals, who are usually center of screen, but not for team sports, where the guys on the edges look even fatter.  All in all, a great TV for the money.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: Greg Smith "Tuscano"
Reviews.Content: This television is OK, but for the price I guess I should not have expected better. The quality of the connections seems to be somewhat fragile and cheaply made, but at least it is working. Just a cheap set for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: Perfect 2nd set - excellent value
Reviews.Author: T. Mclean
Reviews.Content: Excellent value in this sleek-looking 19" HD set, which is ideal size for kitchen, bedroom, etc. Picture is impressive, sharp with good color saturation. Sound is surprisingly good for a smaller set - no need for external speakers. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: B. Garcia
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as second video gaming TV for the living room. I didn't want nor need all the bells and whistles of a more expensive TV. Has a digital tuner and the picture is clear on the over-the-air channels. Also, hooked up to my satellite receiver, the picture is great. The only complaint I have is that there is no HDMI input. I did not realize this when until I got it home, however, when I hooked the video game system to it, I was pleased.Overall, it's a good little TV and I will recommend it for a kid's room, kitchen, garage, bedroom, dorm, or as I did, a second video gaming TV in living room.

Reviews.Title: Average TV good use for small rooms
Reviews.Author: Twoboz "Twoboz"
Reviews.Content: The Good:The TV served its purpose which was for a small bedroom. It was able to have cable or antenna TV. No major issues for the first 8 months. Audio is Average and picture is average as well.The Bad:Customer service is horrible if you have issues good luck getting it resolved. My A/V port on the TV lost the video portion and was no longer usable for items such as ps3 or DVD players.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Nannax3
Reviews.Content: I wonder how long other reviewers had this TV before they wrote there review.  I purchased it 11/26/09 I thought it was a nice buy and looked good in my kitchen but I now find outh the only good thing is the 1 yr warranty.  Then again that is not so great because the nearest authorized service center is a 45 minute drive away. Since it is in the kitchen it doesnt get much use so I dont understand why it just dies.  I have had to bring it in for repairs 2 times already and went to turn it on tonight and yes you guessed it dead again.  On its way back for a 3rd time before the warranty runs out.  By the way they refuse to replace it.

Reviews.Title: Decent Buy for a Decent TV
Reviews.Author: Leo Ricketts
Reviews.Content: Picture is decent, needs some adjusting depending on lighting but easy to use format, no HMDI port, just AV, monitor display port, and cable input. Volume is decent, able to watch and play movies through DVD, Blu-ray, Roku, PS3, Xbox 360, with decent picture and sound. Overall a decent buy for under $100, would not spend any more than that, good for a children's room, kitchen, bathroom, or college dorm TV. Would not suggest for large living rooms considering its so small.

Reviews.Title: Worked great
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Still going strong today, this TV had everything I wanted in a TV and it worked really well. Still haven't had any problems with it.

Reviews.Title: bought from BJ's
Reviews.Author: Renee Russell "R.R"
Reviews.Content: Love this tv. We bought it for my 4year old son's room, and it's a really great tv with good quality. We are getting two more, one for my Daughter and stepson for college.

Reviews.Title: amazing deal
Reviews.Author: Oracle "painetdldy"
Reviews.Content: nice little tv for a great price.  i can find nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: poor picture
Reviews.Author: ken
Reviews.Content: purchased this tv at walmart, took it home and set it up, when we got it programed to our cable hook up we were disapointed in the picture quality, not as sharp as what we saw in the store. I boxed it back up and took it back the next day, found out that they hook up the tv's in store in a totally different way which we do not have available to us at home.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 6 months
Reviews.Author: Jane C. Eller
Reviews.Content: I bought this from our smalltown TV store in July 2011, not wanting to buy from the Big Box store. It was doing great until the picture started fading away. I took it back to the store I bought it from, sad to say, they were getting ready to go out of business. They checked it out and said that one of panel hadn't been soddered right, so I took it home, lasted 4 more days when the picture went out again.  I took it back and about a week later, they told me they couldn't fix it. I have always bought TV's from these people, so I was a little disappointed in the TV.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: frederick "doc_47"
Reviews.Content: I bought this set for my 10 year old. Paid a lot less than the $211 Amazon is currently asking so as far as I'm concerned this set is great. In addition to connecting right up to our cable we also used it as a computer monitor and connected a DVD player to it. The lack of HDMI is a non issue. It's simple, light and easy to use. Wish I would have bought 2 of them.

Reviews.Title: crap connection points
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: This Tv cpmany forces you to use only component connections when youneed a 2nd device! and component cables are not somethign that come standard with dvd players or game system or capcorders or.... anythin gelse!

ProductInfo.Features:
720p (1280x720) HDTV format
1000:1 Contrast ratio
Integrated digital tuner
5ms Response Time
3D Comb Filter latest color technology for reduced image artifacts
ProductInfo.Name: Sansui HDLCD1912 19-Inch 720p LCD HDTV, Black
